contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Taxobox | name = Xestia praevia | image = Xestia_praevia.jpg | image_width = 240px | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropod]]a | classis = [[Insect]]a | ordo = [[Lepidoptera]] | familia = [[Noctuidae]] | genus = ''[[Xestia]]'' | species = '''''X. praevia''''' | binomial = ''Xestia praevia'' | binomial_authority = Lafontaine, 1998 | synonyms = }} '''''Xestia praevia''''' is a [[moth]] of the [[Noctuidae]] family. It is found in [[Canada]] ([[New Brunswick]], [[Quebec]], [[Manitoba]], [[Saskatchewan]], [[Alberta]] and [[British Columbia]]) south to [[California]]. It is part of the ''elimata'' species group. Three of the species in this group (''Xestia praevia'', ''[[Xestia elimata]]'' and ''[[Xestia badicollis]]'') have no significant difference in both genitals and DNA, suggesting they may be in fact one species. This [[wingspan]] is about 32 mm. The moth flies from July to August depending on the location. The [[larva]] feed on ''[[Pinus ponderosa]]''. ==External links== *[http://imfc.cfl.scf.rncan.gc.ca/insecte-insect-eng.asp?geID=1000148 Species info] {{Noctuinae-stub}} [[Category:Xestia]]
